iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Folklore collection in Morogoro area
iati-activity.description: Aims: Strengthen the identity of people in Morogoro area by increasing their knowledge on local history, culture and traditions; enhance the capacity of partner organisation in collecting, editing and archiving oral, non-oral information, collected items etc. Activities: Training of key persons in collection, editing and archieving; purchasing material, like tape recorders; visits to Tanzanian museums; use of collected information / material in schools.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Support for Aids-orphans education
iati-activity.description: The project aims to support the AIDS orphans in the Arumeru and Monduli district and to enable the children's schooling. In the project there will be support for construction materials of schools, acquiring school unioforms, study supply and furniture. The aim is also to plant trees around the school.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Pre School Support Programme . The Pre-School Support Programme aims to improve the capacity of a local partner to respond to the educational needs of pre-school aged children. The government of Tanzania wishes to increase the amount of pre-schools in the country but lacks resources and_ thus_ gladly welcomes NGOs to start their own pre-schools. Seizing this opportunity_ Fida and the Free Pentecostal Church of Tanzania (FPCT) have partnered since 1998 and established already 200 pre-schools around Tanzania. The programme assists local churches in starting and running their own pre-schools through teacher training_ small-scale construction support for the new school buildings and provision of school materials. All pre-school operations are supervised by the FPCT Department of Early Childhood Education. Through the programme_ FPCT becomes increasingly able to start and run its own pre-schools. In fact_ all the pre-schools established during the programme are already entirely run by the local churches. This type of development will contribute to the overall improvement of pre-school education in Tanzania.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Youth Centres in Pemba_ Zanzibar and Mafia. The project aims at building up the capacity of the local partner to run a sustainable youth ministry on the islands of Pemba_ Zanzibar and Mafia. The youth on the Tanzanian islands lack sufficient vocational training and they have poor life management skills. Unemployment rate is high and drug abuse is common among the youth. To address the situation_ the Free Pentecostal Church of Tanzania (FPCT) and Fida began youth work on the islands in 1998. Fida and FPCT have established youth centres on Zanzibar and Pemba. Now a new centre will be established also on Mafia. These centres_ run by FPCT_ offer the youth vocational training_ constructive free-time activities and information on e.g. health issues and life skills. Through the project_ the capacity of FPCT to run the youth centres in a sustainable way increases and the centres will be able to become independent. As a result of the activities run in the centres_ the life management skills of the youth living on the islands will improve.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Empowering Churches for Youth Ministry . The programme aims to improve the capacity of a local partner to meet the needs of the youth in the cities. Over 30 % of the population of Tanzania is between 10â24 years old. Most of these youth live in poverty and without access to proper education. Large numbers of them are flowing into the cities in search for work but often find themselves worse off than before. Fida and the Free Pentecostal Church of Tanzania have worked together since 1997 to address the needs of these youth. The programme provides the partner assistance in offering vocational education and recreational activities as well as information on HIV/AIDS and substance abuse to the youth. The work is done through youth centres established around Tanzania. New youth centres will be established throughout the programme. Through the work done at the centres_ the partnerâs skills in youth work are strengthened. In addition_ the life management skills of the youth build up. As a result_ the youth are able to find employment_ build up a strong ethical value base_ and lead stable lives in the cities.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Resource mobilisation for poor girls' second education
iati-activity.description: Number of girls enrolled to secondary schools in Tanzania is one of the lowest in the world. Project is addressing the access to secondary education of female children of poor families in Morogoro region. Activities: expansion of enrolment, construction and renovation of classrooms, provision of teaching materials, creation of shcolarship system and fund raising practices. Sensitizastion of communities.

iati-activity.title: District Economic and Social Empowerment Programme_ DESEMP_ I implemen
iati-activity.description: The District Economic and Social Empowerment Program (DESEMP) has been designed as a new type of development partnership for strengthening the private sector for pro-poor growth in Mtwara and Lindi Regions in the Southern Tanzania. It aims to effectively support key drivers for growth and thus unlock the economic potentials along specific commodity value chains by mobilising land_ capital_ skills and technology. DESEMP builds upon the concept that business is good for development and development is good for the business.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable Management of Land and Environment_ SMOLE_ II
iati-activity.description: SMOLE aims at reducing absolute poverty in the society through environmentally sound land management and socio-economic development. The Project consists of four main components: 1. Institutional Development_ 2. Land Management_ 3. Environmental Management_ 4. Awareness Raising. Specific objective for SMOLE II_ which will cover the period of June 2009 â May 2013_ is to achieve the medium level of operations and feasibility in sustainable land and environmental management.

iati-activity.description: Support to ICT development in Tanzania in a regional and global environment.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Forest conservation by livelihood development in Zanzibar Live-project
iati-activity.description: Aim: To achieve economic empowerment of local communities without compromising nature conservation of the forest reserves (sustainable use of natural resources). Activities: training and awareness raising; support on income generating activities; facilitate small-scale enterprise establishment; capacity building of local CBOs and forestry administration

iati-activity.description: Morogoro Youth Center support. Youth work enables youth a safe network and a place for guidance_ education_ activities and entrepreneurship knowledge.

iati-activity.description: Aim: increased use of rainwater harvesting and small-scale drip irrigation in rural drylands for fruits and firewood; improved livelihoods through diversified income and protection of environment. Activities: awareness raising; training; group forming; building water tanks for rainwater harvesting from roofs; agricultural and forestry activities

iati-activity.description: Aim: Enhance youth entrepreneurship training; capacity building of Tanzanian 4H in organising training; networking within African 4H organisations. Activities: Organising yearly international training seminars in Tanga_ Tanzania; preparation of training material. Seminars are targeted to African 4H organisations.

iati-activity.title: National forest and environment assessment
iati-activity.description: Following a request for assistance from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), the Government of Finland (the Government), shall make available, on a grant basis and subject to annual parliamentary approval in Finland, a contribution amounting up to a maximum of US Dollars three million seventeen thousand one hundred and fifty-seven, EUR 1 929 593 (in writing one million ninehundredtwentyninethousand and fifehundredninetythree euros, hereinafter the Contribution) to provide support to the Strengthening Forest Resources Management and Enhancing its Contribution to Sustainable Development, Landuse and Livelihoods - National Forestry Resources Monitoring and Assessment in Tanzania (the Project) as set out in the Project Document attached hereto during the period of 2008-2011.

iati-activity.title: Study on public private partnership in forestry sector
iati-activity.description: Study on public private partnership in forestry sector.

iati-activity.title: Supporting activities to NFBKP
iati-activity.description: Forestry Sector Wide Approach. Suppporting activities to NFBKP.

iati-activity.title: Election Support Programme
iati-activity.description: Tanzania will organice it's presidental, parliamentary and municipality elections in October 2010. UNDP, together with the government of Republic of Tanzania and it's development partners have developed an Elections Support Project (ESP) that is dedicated to strengthen the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) capasity to follow trough the elections independently and transparently. The ESP's main goal is to further strengthen national capabilities for the implementation of free, fair and credible elections, with support to the preparations, management and conduct of the elections. The focus is the strengthening of the national leadership of EMBs and engagement of political parties, media, and other civid society as well as national security management institututions in contributing to the overall goal and to prevent to post elections violence.

iati-activity.title: Institute for Sustainable Develoment
iati-activity.description: Many countries of the South need to enhance their capacity for designing national policies and dialogue. While recognising wider global needs, the proposed institute will initially focus on the East African region and selected themes, such as global trade and environment issues. Countries of this region have entered into trade and economic agreements that have imposed constraints and opportunities to their national development policy regimes. The value-added of this institution will be to add capacities in the region to analyse and evaluate the implications of regional and international agreements on their national policy regimes. Understanding the implications of trade and economic agreements on national policy will not only make them relevant to the global developments, but it will also support the shaping of global agreements to suit national and regional priorities.

iati-activity.title: Project to support the Geological Survey of Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The main objective for the co-operation is strengthening of the institutional capacity in the selected fields of mapping, IT-upgrading and improved theoretical skills.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Save firewood
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to decrease environmental destruction caused by firewood collection in ten villages of Mwanga District, and reduce the time women and girls use for fetching firewood. The project promotes wood-saving stove models, which are also reducing health risks caused by emission gases of inefficient burning. The activities include raising awareness of wood-saving stoves and the impact of firewood quality, training the construction of stoves and business planning and conducting a comparative study on firewood-saving stoves.

location.name: Eastern lowlands of Mwanga District, Tanzania

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Sports for mothers and daughters
iati-activity.description: Aimed at: strengthening possibilities for girls to have education in the field of sports; creating activities for girls and mothers; offering possibilities for different age groups to join activities with their peers; and to make communities aware of their surrounding environment.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Bridgeit Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Tanzanian schools are poorly equipped, with many lacking electricity and basic infrastructure, lab equipment and textbooks. Primary school teachers receive minimal support and training and lack sufficient skills and resources to engage young people. The Teacher Training College (TTC) Bridgeit program will train professors and student teachers in 2 teacher training colleges on participatory and gender-responsive teaching methods, with particular focus on mathematics, science and life skills. The project seeks to build the capacity of the Tanzanian Ministry of Education and Vocational Training (MoEVT) and institutionalize the Bridgeit training and methodologies into the pre-service teacher training.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Mtukwao Participatory Media Project, Mtwara ja Lindi
iati-activity.description: The project aims to support society journalism in Mtwara and Lind provinces by providing necessary equipment and financing seminars, training courses, video productions, editing of radio programmes and theatre that are created by the society. Participatory media aims to raise conversation about issues important to people living in countryside. It tries to offer possibilities to people at grass roots level to participate public conversation about issues concerning their matters, and alternatives of development. Along with it participatory media tries to give possibility to affect so that the best solutions can be found to develop one's own neighbouring area.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Improving the electric power supply reliability in Dar es Salaam
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the project is to improve the electic power supply reliability in the city of Dar es Salaam. The proposed project scope has been designed to improve power supply reliability especially in the central area of Dar es Salaam (mainly Ilala Region), not fully covered projects of other donors. There is no duplication in relation to funding and implementation of the proposed project. The project concentrates on the MV 33kV network. The main benefits will be considerable reduction of technical losses and overall reliability of power supply. The implementation of the components proposed under the scope will therefore ensure the availability of improved power supply, decrease operating costs and increase the revenue of TANESCO.

iati-activity.title: Capacity Building for Border Mangement for Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Based on the strategy of the first phase, this project will expand the activities from Phase I to include more border posts and most importantly to include all five EAC Partner States along their borders with Tanzania. In addition to the technical and training components more focus will also be given to activities that will assist the Immigration authorities in adapting the existing structures to international standards of border management, such as the separation of incoming and outgoing travellers at a BCP so that they do not meet.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Budget Support to Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The budget support of Tanzania will be evaluated as a joint effort of various OECD/DAC donors. Finland parrticipates in the Reference group and will also contribute to financing of the evaluation and by recruiting an expert as a resource person, altogether 100 000â¬.

iati-activity.description: Investment-related loan through Finnfund, Leasing of airgraft construction.

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term establishment / partnership in the target country (e.g. subsidiary, maintenance company, joint venture, subcontractor agreement)

iati-activity.title: Fuata Barabara Entrepreneurship project for single mothers in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Fuata Barabara is an entrepreneurship project for single mothers in Tanzania

iati-activity.title: Development of the Potato Sector in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The project aims at developing in a sustainable way the quality seed potato production by supporting key Tanzanian organizations, particularly the Agricultural Research Institute in Uyole.
iati-activity.participating-org: Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR)

iati-activity.title: URT/Shelter for Women
iati-activity.description: Shelter Kwieco is going to be constructed to help the victims of domestic violence and to improve the womens social position in the society. Concrete activities are: construct the shelter and organise the shelter's activities with the help of Finnish organisation which is a specialist in this field.

iati-activity.title: Livelihoods and Forest Conservation
iati-activity.description: The vision for the Greater Mahale Ecosystem developed by ecosystem partners An exemplary Greater Mahale Ecosystem in which globally important biodiversity and ecosystem functions are conserved, habitat connectivity is maintained, and natural resources are managed in a way that sustains or improves local livelihoods for the benefit of present and future generations. To support this vision the project will focus on 5 primary villages within the GME. Objectives for each strategic action are listed below and listed in attached log frame model.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: WLAC aims to improve personal and material security of women and children and contribute towards national poverty reduction campaign through legal aid, research and networking and outreach program. Specific objectives include: 1) increased women and children access to justice through court 2) Community awareness on women's legal rights and effects of gender based violence increased 3) Access to justice amongst vulnerable groups in the rural areas through paralegal services increased 4) Repeal of discriminatory laws and practices advocated for 5) Enhanced institutional capacity of WLAC

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Sustainable Breakfast School Feeding Programme is implemented by the NGO called Feed the Children Tanzania. Main objectives of the activities are as follows: 1) to alleviate short-term hunger in malnourished or otherwise well nourished school children. This helps to increase the attention and concentration of students producing gains in cognitive function and learning 2) to motivate parents to enroll their children in school and have them attend regularly 3) to address specific micronutrient deficiencies in schoolage children 4) to increase community involvement in schools particularly where programs depend on the community to prepare and serve meals to children. Thus , the project will conduct introductory school feeding awareness creation training; construct simple kitchens; construct energy efficient wood burning stoves; purchase cooking pots and initial supply of food.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The Makuya Festival is an exciting celebration of the traditional performing arts and culture of Mtwara Region in Tanzania.The Centre for African Development through Economics and the Arts (ADEA) is organising this festival. Objectives of the activities are: 1) to promote, preserve and perpetuate the traditional performing arts of Mtwara region 2) to document the cultural, traditional and historic knowledge of the elders before their generation passes 3) to reconnect the younger generation of Tanzania to their rich heritage and to expose this cultural richness to international visitors. Funds will be used for festival preparations and support interviews with the elderss to learn learn of their heritage as well as documenting through recordings and photographs items of traditional life.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Main objectives of the Research on Poverty Alleviation is to 1) Strengthen the capacity of the intellectual resources through Developing Research Capacity. 2) Undertake, facilitate and encourage strategic research through providing senior researchers with opportunities to undertake strategic research, update their skills and participate in knowledge sharing 3) Facilitate and stimulate the Utilisation of Research findings through providing key development agents with opportunities to develop their skills in the use of research outputs 4) Enhance REPOA's Capacity to implement the Strategic Plan.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: Tanzania Youth Alliance is a National Youth NGO implementing its activities through Information Communication Technologies (ICT)to address social challenges on HIV/AIDS.The objectives of the project are: 1) to contribute to National Multi Sectoral Framework (NMSF)by building youth leadership for prevention at their community and policy level through introducing individual treatment SMS that will provide counseling support short messages linked with referral system of care and treatment clinics 2) to contribute to NMSF through SMS Health promotion for specific vulnerable groups by conducting telephone counseling and SMS helpline on reducing the practice of multiple partnerships - promotion of access to preventive services through SMS by building SMS helpline database with short messages on HIV/AIDS prevention

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The purpose of Tanzania Corruption Tracker System (CTS) is to scale up track record of publicly available information on presumed or confirmed cases of corruption in order to increase accoutability and responsiveness and citizen engagement in the fight against corruption. Main activities include;Collection of information on cases of corruption; Establishment of a bilingual (Kiswahili&English)website for the CTS. Preparation and printing of selected articles; Conducting periodic public dialogues; Preparation and airing of TV scrolls on anti corruption messages targeting political corruption.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The project objective is conservation of environment through participation of Kisarawe District Communities in commercial forestry management measures. Main activities include : Establishment of Environmental Conservation Groups;Establishment of tree nurseries and trees planted; Community Forestry Protection by laws established and agreed; Lobbying and advocacy conducted to target group and District authorities to increase resources for forest conservation.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The Zanzibar Legal Service Centre aspires to contribute in building a vibrant society which respects democracy, human rights, the rule of law and good governance practices.Therefore the project acquires and disseminate information and documents about laws and other legal matters relevant to the needs of various groups of the communities.Provide legal assistance, advice and counseling.Conducts training on civic and voters' education to communities as well as capacity building to the staff.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The project aims at promoting and strengthening the business cooperation between Tanzania and Finland.The objectives are to make the business delegation event articulate issues on realistic grounds that reflect available and emerging investment potentials in Tanzania.Also build confidence of the Finnish business people to focus their investment plans in Tanzania as well as to establish business relationship among the business people from Finland and Tanzania. The project will support organising the seminar, design and print local company profiles and prepare business information booklet

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The main objectives of the project is to advocate for rights of people with disabilities,strengthen leadership structures at national and district levels as well as capacity building of members through different types of training and provision of rehabilitation services to people with disabilities. Therefore funds were provided for 1) training on good governance for UWZ Executive Board 2) support functioning of UWZ district committees 3) training on how to start business 4) sign language training for deaf people 5) awareness seminars on Zanzibar Disability Act and UN Convention on rights of people with disabilitie 6) production of TV and radio programmes on disability issues and rights of people with disabilities. Organisation: Organisation of People with Disabilities in Zanzibar (UWZ)

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Tanzania
iati-activity.description: The project undertakes measures for the control of the House Crow which is an invasive species with great impacts on other avifauna in the City of Dar es Salaam plus localities where it has invaded. The overall objective is to eradicate the population of house crows in Tanzania. The project will create awareness campaign on house crow; monitor deployed house crow traps in Dar es Salaam; carry out intensive poisoning campaign in Dar and conduct nest with chicks bounty. Organisation: Wildlife Conservation Society of Tanzania

iati-activity.title: Msingi Girls to School Project
iati-activity.description: A secondary school has been built in Msingi some two years ago. It is a day school. Parents living in any further distance from the school are not willing to send their girls to school because of danger of sexual abuse. There is a great need of a protected hostel for girls.
